title: No confidentiality at front desk
body:
The front desk doesn't provide any data protection, people are asked of their names, d.o.b. and address, and have to give them out loud everyone hearing.
A person today needed a form for sample collection, and instead of asking only (would have been still heard be everyone) their name, the front desk staff asked very loudly what sort of sample it would have been. I don't think it was necessary, as based on their name and d.o.b./address they could have found the form, now we all now the person needed a sperm sample form, and I think they felt embarrassed.

title: Excellent practice
body: Always polite and friendly. Running on time. Very kind and caring. Problems dealt with efficiently.

title: Disappointed
body: Called the surgery over a repeat prescription. The first two minutes of the call was an almost inaudible  pre recorded message from the surgery outlining the steps patients can take if they are unable to get an appointment with a doctor. Anyone who is hard of hearing would be in great difficulty trying to work out what was being said. Once the pre recording was over I was informed I was number 1 in the queue. 17 minutes later with just the sound of music playing I hung up.

title: Wonderful care and outcome
body: I am so pleased with the results of my two eye operations - one to repair a hole in my retina when the lens was also replaced and the second for a cataract. The care was exemplary and the outcome has left me without the need for prescription glasses or contact lenses. I only need simple reading glasses and my eyesight was incredibly poor before. I have not seen this well for over 50 years!!

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Include emotional wellbeing/mental health ask as…
body: I feel prompted to leave a review to suggest a way to improve is - when a patient is having consultations and conversations about fertility, the GP needs to ask about the patient's mental health and emotional wellbeing. I have had about 3 GP appointments now about fertility issues. The GPs have always been good and given sound advice but I haven't once been asked "how are you feeling about all this?" or "how is this impacting on your emotional wellbeing at the moment?" This should be added as a standard question to any appointment with any patient of any gender about fertility issues.

title: Excellent Hospital Care
body:
I was brought into A@E by ambulance with severe stomach pain, A@E is always busy but by evening I was found a bed in the “surgical assessment ward” just off Chiltington ward here I was treated with kindness and efficiency by the nursing teams on both shifts, this high standard continued when I was transferred to Chiltington ward proper.
In my stay at Worthing hospital I was given a scan and a endoscopic examination to determine my bowel problem again both these departments treated me with kindness and reassurance.
Every member of staff I met seemed positive even the catering and cleaning staff who often go unmentioned keeping the hospital clean and the patients well fed deserve high praise.
Overall a very positive experience.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body: Dr very easy to communicate with and didn't try to rush me. Receptionist pleasant. A positive experience altogether.

title: This GP Practice needs to improve asap
body: I cannot believe how awful this practice is! You are advised to use the AskFirst App to book an appointment but when you try there are no appointments available. You call the surgery and no one answers; you're left  waiting in a queue for goodness knows for how long and then your call is terminated and this process is repeated over and over again until you just give up...My advice is please find another GP  as sadly this one will leave you frustrated.

title: Extremely long wait time and no appointments!
body: I spent 30 minutes on hold - being told I was fourth, third, second and then first in the queue. When the phone finally rang, it took a further 15 minutes for anyone to answer!! (Yes I waited that long to see if someone would eventually pick up). I finally got through to the practice to book a doctor's appointment to be told they didn't have any appointments and to phone back tomorrow at a specific time for more appointments to be released! The member of staff offered no apology for the ridiculous wait time and no apology for the fact they couldn't find me an appointment. What a waste of time!

title: Poor service
body: Phoned by practice but on answering the call could not hear anyone this was the case on afew calls was not expecting a call so tryed to see if my phone  was having a problem which it wasent so dialed the number to be in contact with surgery to be put in a queue went down said queue after 30mins to be 1 in queue only to wait another 45mins and not get an answer soon relised this phone was not being answered this is not the first time this has occured

title: Fantastic practice
body: On time appointment,  Doctor didn't make me feel pressured for time. He listened and advised well. Still a bit of a hassle trying to book appointment via phone though.

title: Cancelled Appointment
body: Cancelled my appointment for a Taxi medical. This has put my renewal in complete disarray but they don't seem to care. They claim to have a doctor off sick but can't rearrange with a different Doctor. I could potentially be forced to sit out work for a number of weeks because of this.

title: Beacon Primary Care Minor Ops Team
body:
5 star performance from me.
My minor op was probably only about 3 weeks after I reported it to my GP so there was a surprisingly short wait.
I was seen at the allotted time and the two members of staff immediately put me at ease. The procedure was explained to me and the process of getting stitches removed later was also discussed. This gave me confidence that this was a straightforward minor op and that the team knew what they were doing. 10 days later and the stitches have been removed without any problems and infections and a very neat piece of work too.

title: Poor appointment practice
body: After receiving a text to say i needed to book an appointment after blood test results had been received by a GP, I immediately called and once through booked an appt for the following Tuesday.  Quite happy with that I then received a call to say I could no longer have that appointment and to call back another day. When asking when to call, told perhaps middle of next week. I said I was on the phone now and it was the surgery who had asked me to call and was told it was out of their hands. The lady I spoke to was all very nice and not her fault but now Im left wondering why the need to talk to me knowing that it could be weeks before I get to speak to a Doctor. I only had the blood test 2 days ago. Really not good service. For such a large practice getting an appointment if your lucky enough to get on a phone line, is a right mission.

title: Very Poor Service
body:
Really poor duty of care and the worst GP surgery I have ever encountered. I don't doubt that the clinicians care but the processes and policies are a shocking disgrace, left waiting over 3 weeks for test results despite ringing continually, promised call backs do not materialise, inconsistencies in response to reasons why it took so long. No follow up from discharge from hospital - can it get any worse.
The onus is on the patient to remind the surgery what needs to happen and do the follow up and chasing.
I changed to this surgery for convenience to my home, not actually seen a doctor in the 3 years or so I have been on the books and really wished I hadn't changed.
It is clear that everybody at the surgery is overwhelmed with the workload , they need a visit from the CQC to shake up the management and get resources in place - only then will real care and responsibility come.

title: Excellent service
body: Contacted practice re recurring problem & received excellent service from the person that answered the phone and dealt with my requirements and from the subsequent call from a doctor & visit later to be assessed with follow up later that day. No surprise really as this matches all previous dealings with the practice. Absolutely faultless. Many, many thanks.

title: Best practice at the best practice
body: We have found that everyone at this practice is professional , friendly and efficient .  From answering the phone and making appointments to making referrals and tests. To contacting us to see how we had got on at a hospital appointment the previous day. We couldn’t ask for more. Thank you everyone .

title: Fabulous responsive service
body: Thank you so much - I used the new replacement “Patches” for E Consult - easy to use - excellent GP response - service easy to use & response from GP & change in meds Prescription received & changes made within 24 hours of request - fantastic

title: Caring Doctor
body:
First visit as a new patient was genuinely impressed with the clean modern surgery. Reception & Dispensary  Ladies are super helpful and friendly 
Dr was kind, caring, and genuinely wanted to help me. I was very happy we made the move to this practice thank you very much

title: Stomach pain visit
body: I attended the surgery after having extreme pain in my lower abdomen for three days. The doctor treated me with respect and although he couldn’t find any immediate cause of the pain he has made arrangements for further tests to be conducted.

title: Great service
body:
Helpful receptionist, appointment made and I was seen on time.
The nurse was friendly and patient, listening to my concerns and then reassuring that she / the practice could help me.
A second appointment was made and another nurse was just as kind and patient with me, I felt listened to and reassured and she took time explaining my options and medications. 
I then had a follow up phone call and a further appointment to check on my progress.
After feeling 'not quite myself' and previously having been told there was nothing medically that could be done, the service I received from these two nurses has had a huge impact and has seriously changed my daily life and I cannot thank them enough!

title: Very experienced and courteous practise
body: I have found the Dr and staff to be very helpful, courteous and expert in their job. On this as well as on previous occasions I have been accommodated very quickly. Dr is very thorough in listening, keeping the notes and making sense of the scenario. A clever Dr who can quickly analyse  the 360 assessment.

title: Unhelpful
body: My GP receptionist sent me to this practice, which informed me that this was for emergencies only, so a complete waste of time given that my husband has Parkinson’s Disease and I have no support from anyone whatsoever.  I have been fobbed off by Lockwood Surgery, Poulton for well over 5 + years with the same problem that I attended here for, which had been waking me up daily when I need all the sleep and rest possible under the circumstances.  We are supposed to trust our surgery to go where they suggested as there is no GP available until 13/06/23, not sent from pillar to post wasting time and petrol going to Fleetwood for nothing but rude couldn’t give a damn attitudes!!

title: Great Practice but poor receptionist  performance
body: I have requested the link to my medical records 3 time by phone with a complete failure to be provided despite the promise to send an email with the link. Today I did a blood test the nurse accompanied me to the receptionist to make sure I get the link. The receptionist promised to send an email with link but that never materialised for the fourth time!

title: Disappointing
body: Tried for weeks to get a routine appointment to be told you need to ring at 8am even for routine. On hold for over 45mins every time I’ve rang, gave up in the end. Can’t even put an econsult in as they get turned off. Things have gotten so bad that the GP practice I work for have had to refer me for a scan last year and do my bloods earlier this week and both times I have been diagnosed with something. Find it ridiculous that I have had to put a temp residency in with my workplace to be seen. Very thankful to them for being so good with me. As someone who works in this industry I understand the strain GP practices and the staff are under but you really need to sort your appointment system out. I’ve never had any issues until now been with this surgery all my life

title: Responsive to emails
body: Although it took a while to explain and organise the things I need, Brunton Park Health Centre reception team was efficient in sending me the test results of my blood tests and communicative over email correspondence. Good job.

title: Gone downhill, rapidly.
body:
Sadly, since introducing their new "online" system for booking appointments, it is now impossible to get one. With the form only being available during surgery hours, this stops anyone who leaves early for work, spends the day at work, and then travels home, with no opportunity to book an appointment unless they have internet access at work. 

Whilst many people have smartphones and laptops, my job often means I don't have an internet connection at the customer site, so I am being made to wait until I am not at work just to be able to book an appointment.

I tried to book an appointment over the phone but the very rude receptionist said I must do this online. When I pointed out that their policy is discriminating against those who do not have online access, the lady was patronising and said "i'll do it for you once this time, but next time you'll have to do it online".

This surgery regularly fails to pick up on important clinical findings, only really choosing to select a course of treatment if it involves them prescribing something, or drug pushing as I call it.

If you do manage to get an appointment, god help you if you bring more than one thing to the session as you are told off, even though you can't get double appointments.

The lack of care and compassion seen in the past months with this surgery is appalling. Unfortunately I became frustrated during an appointment because the doctor dismissed my claims. Everything is "functional" according to them. When I got a little frustrated I was patronised and said I could be referred for counselling.

Not fit for purpose anymore this surgery, so will be changing.

title: Good experience
body:
I understand the other reviews are very negative, but my experience of this practice has been very good so far. My partner has been unwell for the past two weeks and two different visits to the walk-in-centre led to no results. Took two days to use askmygp as sometimes it closes earlier than expected, but once we managed it, got a phone call back in two hours and an appointment in three with an urgent referral for a follow-up. 
Happy to have chose them, we really felt listened

title: Friendly staff
body: It is the only accident and emergency facility that I could get to and I was treated with great care and staff who listened to my symptoms where my gp did not, they helped get a possible diagnosis after months of not being taken seriously.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very kind and helpful practice
body: Great practice, very kind and helpful receptionists and doctors. Would recommend this practice for anyone looking for a local GP

title: Great practice
body: A big  thank you to all the staff for their quick response at getting an ambulance to me when I was having difficulty breathing   Thanks again

title: Pointless
body:
Attended 3 times with vaginal bleeding. They just did a urine and blood test. I was then sent home with some medication, which didn't work. First time they said that the gynaecologist had refused to see me (!), second time that they don't have an ultrasound machine (an entire hospital without an ultrasound machine...), and the third time that my problem had now become long-term and I should go to the GP. They basically refused to treat me. Apparently, a woman my age shouldn't expect any better. 
Of course, it goes without saying that a GP cannot deal with such a situation, and is not qualified to do so. As indeed their own GPs in A&E had failed to provide effective treatment.
Next day the bleeding got into a super heavy flow. 111 said that they are sending an ambulance (from Barnet General). Then they called to say, since the ambulance is too busy can I go to A&E instead? Hell, no, I can't go anywhere, that's why I am calling you. I am a prisoner without a life because you are not treating me. You just take the NHS tax from my salary without asking me and then you neglect my health.
While I was being sent away without any treatment I could see that male patients were being referred for emergency scans.
After I got the bleeding under some control on my own and without the help of anyone here, I flew to Greece to see a gynaecologist urgently privately. He offered to see me and operate at a very short notice after hearing that I'd been bleeding for 2 months non-stop. That is considered an emergency... 
I was seen and operated on the same day. The ultrasound took 2 minutes and the operation 15... Apparently, the bleeding would have carried on for a year at least without the op. 
I got no help and no patient care here. I got treated like a nuisance and like a second-rate patient just for being a woman. The medication prescribed made things worse in the long term. It was only good enough to allow me to board a flight safely to go and see a proper doctor away from Barnet General. There was no interest in my quality of life or well-being. Your doctors are rude and lazy.
My best advice to anyone is to not bother with this A&E Department at all. This department here is not up to modern medical standard. It only wastes your time and delays you going to someone that is actually going to treat you. The main objective of Barnet General A&E doctors is to keep their workload down without any interest for the outlook for the patients. They are happy for you to suffer and let your life bleed out of you so that they don't have to do anything about it. They told me they only do blood transfusions and resuscitation. They just don't want you dying on their premises. They don't care if you do in the next hour after you have left the hospital. 
If it hadn't been for the false hope of treatment here I would have got it much earlier privately. So, use my experience to your own benefit. 
The best thing that can happen to Barnet General A&E is to close it down.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Condescending and anxiety inducing
body: Received a callback from 111. Medical advisor invited me to come to the practice for a checkup. I informed them that I can't walk there for mental health reasons and can't afford a taxi. I also pointed out that in my experience, it's not a safe area to walk through at night. Their response was 'well, that's your choice then'. It's not my choice, and I'm extremely disappointed that they could have been so callous. How can they not see that I'm more terrified of walking long distances than risking dying from asphyxiation in my sleep? They should be sacked, they have a terrible bedside manner. I'm beginning to get used to this dismissive attitude from these 'emergency care' scenarios. To be frank, I feel suicidal now. Thanks for that, my friend in America did more to help me than you did. On a brighter note, they did call back quickly, but holy moly, that's like saying 'at least they punched me early and didn't keep me waiting'.

title: Very good
body:
I have found the CHEC service to be very good.
The staff are always helpful and advising. My appointments have been on time with no delays.
All in all very good.

title: Well looked after
body: I recently came in for an angiogram which I was nervous about. The nursing staff were so reassuring and did their best to make me comfortable. I was very grateful.

title: Treatment disgusting
body: Long term disabled ordered my repeat morphine and never got it went to surgery to find out and they said I need a medication review come back on Mon to speak to doc and this was on a Friday so now I'm in extreme pain waiting on more surgery and iv got no pain relief to take and nowhere to go for help do not register with this doc they even been in paper for messing priscritions about with people and they doing it again

title: Fantastic staff and hospital so organised and…
body: Never been to Stoke hospital before but what a pleasure to meet with so many helpful staff.  Even when we were lost several members of staff assisted us.  Great communications to inform you of patients progress and detailed information.  Cannot praise this hospital highly enough.

title: Appointment s
body: They say book your appointments on line you sign in they is never any appointment s available all you get is sorry nothing available,so you try ringing at 8oclock in the morning after a very long wait you could be 20 in the que , when you get through the reception is so blunt not helpful all you get is no appointment s you will have to try again tomorrow,this is very frustrating when your not well and can’t get appointments . I can’t understand why we can’t get appointments I really think something needs to change so we can book online and if we need to phone appointments should be made available and the receptionist should all be trained in customer service and stop being so rude , sorry I have just had enough I can never get a face to face appointment

title: Relief
body: A little bit of 'how it used to be' is still around. A quaint old hospital with helpful and friendly staff all around when I was enquiring about where the Podiatry Dept was. On arriving at the department I felt relaxed and then I was called in and welcomed by two relaxed and friendly staff. The lady on the computer carefully took my history details and the podiatrist cut my toe nails and removed two corns. They couldn't have been more pleasant and now I'm enjoying great relief. Thank you.

title: Caring GPs
body:
My GP appointment yesterday was excellent, my GP explained the examination very well, was very reassuring throughout and gave me plenty of time in the appointment to discuss my health
Thank you

title: Amazing Hospital
body:
I first visited Montagu in March this year for a consultation about my Bunions and  I had operations on both feet within a month.
I was treated with the best care in every department, I cannot praise the staff enough. I was extremely nervous at having my operations under a local anaesthetic but I had no need to be. My nurse ( wish I could say her name, but I can't) was absolutely amazing and kept me calm, chatting to me all through my operation.
 I was in the day ward and out, surgery done within 6 hours.
I found all departments in Montagu to be spotlessly clean with the most friendly and helpful staff.
Also there has never been a problem parking, great system!
Thankyou so much to all the staff at Montagu for making my experience so easy and stress free.... Would Highly Recommend!!

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unable to get a face to face appointment
body: Have not seen my GP for 18  months or more, to get a telephone appointment takes up to 3 weeks, I have multiple  myeloma and should have regular checks but these don't  happen, after blood tests are taken I phone to get results and then maybe told I need to talk to my GP, who may not be available as I have said before for upto 3 weeks, the whole situation is totally unsatisfactory.  I am disabled which is another complication.  Have rheumatic and back issues, recently asked for a GP home visit, he didn't come but sent a lady who wasn't even a GP.  Would like to change surgeries to one which is more accessible and hopefully helpful.

title: Delay in results
body: I was not forwarded my blood results even though I chased them by calling the practice 4 times. It’s was flagged up as a priority for patient services to email them to me but it was not sent at all

title: Amazing UTC
body: Amazing experience, well looked after and fully examined to detail of injury, all happy stuff & cheerful

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: A practice that is overwhelmed
body:
I visited the accident & emergency after calling 111 and instructed to go. I got to the hospital at 8.30pm and saw a gp at 5.30am the next morning. I was at risk of heart attack and blood pressure of 190/113 but that was not deemed urgent so bumped to the back of the q. Needless to say I was frustrated, wanted to leave and as I was looking around I could see that everyone there was in the same boat. This was the result of a broken Nhs. I have to say that when I saw the Doctor he was thorough, his examination was brilliant and I cannot complain about the service once I received it. 
I think the a&e should start operating on a ticket basis. Most patients there lived locally. If I came in registered and was given the option to say wait for a call to come back in at 5.30am I would have been less stressed, I could have rested etc...Something must be dome to help this system.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional and responsive
body: Following a Patchs request I had a face to face consultation within 3 hours and a treatment programme

title: Wait a month for phone appointment, not called!
body:
Booked the earliest telephone appointment one month wait. Received 2 reminder text messages, but did Not get a call.
Very Frustrating

title: Perfect practice
body: After being healthy all my life. This last 2 years  have been not so good..the response from the practice  as been first class ( even with the problems the NHS is going through) the response from  the staff at reception  is first class.

title: Professional
body: A very professional practice always kept me informed of any changes with prompt reminders and nice staff

title: firs class practice
body:
as it was my first cataract operation was very impressed with the care i recieved from the start.
staff in this practice i could not fault anyone.
this company pick me up and taken home both drivers were very polite very tide.
i wuuld recommed this practice to anyone

title: Made me feel at ease
body: Thank you very much to everyone on Gardner Ward at Conquest Hospital for your fantastic care while I was admitted for my surgery. All of the nurses, the matron, anaesthetists, everyone in the operating theatre and my consultant made me feel so at ease and made for a positive experience despite the circumstances.

title: Great client care
body: The doctor was sensitive and polite to a potentially sensitive situation. The call was prompt and the questions were easy to answer. I did not feel any judgement and the prescription I had requested was given to me.

title: Seen promptly and efficiently
body:
Appointment for blood test, seen on time and took less than 15 minutes!
Only one suggestion to make - this would be a great time to have blood type confirmed for patients, such as myself,  using  medical alert cards.
Very surprised to learn that this information is not on your GP record.

title: Prompt service
body: Called when agreed and was very helpful and understanding. Have never not been called or seen when appointment made.

title: Brilliant Service
body: Given an appointment after waiting behind 15 other people in the queue. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Saw doctor and required bloods and was found a cancellation within 20 minutes so all done and dusted. Doctor , reception staff and blood lady all fantastic. Thank you

title: Caring practice
body:
I came in for a blood test. I wasn’t kept waiting and was dealt with very efficiently.
I have always found the reception staff patient and helpful and the appointment system works well for me.

title: Lacking compassion
body: Receptionist is rude and condescending. Doesn't listen to what's being said and is totally lacking compassion. Needs to undergo further training as a matter of urgency. Shouldn't be dealing with vulnerable patients and their families.

title: Elderly left to wait
body: My 89 year old father arrived at A and E around 16-15 in the afternoon with a suspected blood clot in arm.Left A and E at 12-45 am with injection of blood clot thinners and prescription for more.The wait time for a elderly person of his age is a disgrace ,a suspected blood clot is serious and he should have been seen right away !!!

title: Friendly GP's
body:
Filled in online form was rung back and given a doctors appointment later that day.
Treated with respect and kindness.

title: Great practice
body: Easy appointment, met the nurse on time. Friendly staff who provided appropriate answers to my questions.

title: Audiology Top marks
body:
I attended the audiology Saturday 13th May
Appointment 14.50 seen in 10 minutes of arriving.Service excellent from very pleasant receptionist and nurse.Consultant excellent,said I would be referred re hearing aid.I received a further appointment on 16th in the post only a few days later for June. Thanks to all your wonderfull staff as we live in Runcorn it was worth the travelling.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Usually Good but...
body:
I have been with this practice for years, and I  really like it.But I had a terrible experience today while having my blood taken. The nurse in charge of that, was always cold but she was also alway professional. 
Today she almost inserted the needle in my arm, without cleaning the area where she was going to poke. I politely asked her to do it, blaming my own paranoia. She sighed and was irritated but did use hand sanitizer on my skin before inserting the needle.
The insertion today was particularly painful and when she asked if I was ok, I answered no. Almost 2hours later, I can barely move my arm, and the blood spot on the cotton ball she taped on my skin after the test, is Huge.
I have never experienced anything like that before.

title: Shocking service and unprofessional
body: My wife had an appointment but when we tried to contact the eye service, every phone had the same recorded message “The person you called is unable to take the call. Call later” No message or alternative is given.waste of time!!!

title: An abomination
body: I have been very unwell for 3 weeks and tried to see a GP. I was told that I could not see a GP and all I was offered was a phone call next week, in the morning....between 9am and 2pm! If that doesn't tell you how bad this place is. I have now registered with another GP surgery and hope that this surgery has a good hard look at it's practice. They do not care one bit.

title: fantastic doctor
body: i went to visit the doctor on 31st Dec 2022 for what i believed was a chest infection. the doctor carried out several checks and asked me to  go back to the waiting room for 15 mins and he would recall me to check the results again.  second time round he told me he was calling an ambulance and i would be admitted to hostpital.  the doctor virtually saved my life.  my blood sats were in the 70's and i was going into heart failure.  tests proved i had several blood clots in my heart and lungs.  i spent 6 days in hospital in Critical care unit.  i am slowly recovering with no lasting damage to my heart or lungs.  the doctor was calm and assertive as i tried to leave the surgery.  i was treated before the ambulance arrived via numbulizer and oxygen.  i cannot thank all staff concerned enough.  they worked swiftly and calmly as a team, at no point was i upset or worried about my condition as i knew i was in good hands.  thank you all you do an amazing job with very little thanks.  im getting better every day and can only put that down to the quick reaction of the doctor and his team.  thank you.

title: Great experience
body: Very hard to get an appointment but when I received a message with link to make a booking it was convenient and quickly.

title: Horrible service
body: I called them to book an appointment and they told me to hang up and call on Monday morning to do so. I asked them what would be different then and how I would be handled on Monday and they said that they will book me a slot for a follow up call by the GP. I asked them to ''book me for the next available slot now'' which she did and she said it would be on ''Monday evening''.....What absurdity in the receptionist's behavior!!!Since I am giving them a call and they have access to book me for the next available slot they should simply go ahead and do so instead of asking me to call them again on a different day !!it's simple logic which apparently they are lacking...unless of course they don't want to work and they simply pass the work to the next staff member so they don't have to deal with it

title: Issues Hygiene & Cambridge K
body:
When I visited an inpatient on Cambridge K on 18/5/23 I was concerned that there was a lack of hand sanitiser. The dispenser at the entrance door to Channel was empty, and had been for some time. No dispensers were available on the wall racks. I thought hand hygiene for all was important.
On Cambridge K, I visited at dinner time and both my friend and the patient in the next bed had their meal tray just left on their side-tables. There was no attempt to move the side-table nearer to the patient, and he wasn't able to adjust the side-table, or move it closer. Dirty cutlery and a cold un-drunk cup of tea remained on the table. 
The ward was also cluttered.
As I was there, I helped my friend to eat his meal, but what would have happened if I weren't there?

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Chocolate teapot
body:
Prior to Teldoc bring the majority of GP surgerys under there control I and many others could speak to a receptionist and actually get appointments or speak to a doctor. 

Once Teldoc came into place, they have demolished a service which was very good previously and made it impossible to get any appointment or to even speak with a doctor. 

Unfortunately when calling for appointments they often tell me no appointments for the week ahead and need to try again next week or at 8am the next morning when the lines are often over capacity resulting in the call being cut off.

title: Very attentive and considerate staff
body:
Just had an appointment today, got to the practice at 8:10am and booked to be seen at 9:40 by my doctor at the holborn road. 
From the reception desk to the doctors, I don't have anything to complain. Always so nice and attentive, it's a pleasure going there.

title: Faster service
body: no longer wait at this GP dictators and staff very helpful and kind, been supportive through all the appointment

title: Great experience
body: All staff at spamedica wolverhampton were excellent. Doctor who treated me was great cannot thank him enough.

title: Unbelievable service
body: Joined practice in January. Recently asked a gp for a sick certificate and still haven’t received it! now on 3rd day, called surgery and was left in a queue as number “1” still waited half an hour until someone answered, I explained that I’m still waiting for the sick certificate to be sent to me and a emergency prescription to be signed of and was told leave it with me I will see what I can do!! Not good enough never known such awful service, I told gp my mental health is on the brink and didn’t know what way to turn, I was told up your tablets and I will book you in with mental health team, received an appointment for June….. Don’t bother with this surgery you won’t get any help apart from getting stressed out

title: Terrible experiences
body: It's almost impossible to see a GP. They stopped my medication without telling me why and when I tried to sort it out all I could speak to was the receptionist who didn't know why it had been stopped either. There is no continuity of care with this practice and they do not make reasonable adjustments for the vulnerable or help people who need more accessibility. There is no way to resolve issues if things go wrong, if you phone them you just get told 'phone back later' and it's like a merry go round. I have just given up now and have changed to a different practice.

title: The very worst pharmacy
body: This pharmacy is terrible and gets worse every time I visit. There is always a queue and no wonder because they never have the prescription ready and always ask you to return the next day. They are disorganised, slow, poorly managed and have no idea of improvement for the future.

title: Great doctor surgery
body: The staff are really polite, great service always on time doesn’t take you long to get an appointment

title: very good
body: my experience was very good and the service i received was brilliant the audiology explained everything properly

title: Extremely Dissapointed
body: We have had the worst experience with Bolton Diabetes Centre. My husband has recently been diagnosed with Diabetes and has been put on a insulin 4 times a day. We are supposed to give 'Duty Nurse' Blood Sugar Readings every 2 days so insulin units can be adjusted. As we didn't hear anything back from them, we've tried contacting them however, each time receptionist advices duty nurse will call you back and it has now been 1 and half week!

title: Marvellous
body:
I could not have asked for more.  I have been seen quickly and professionally by all involved.  
Thank you

title: Not Good
body: Been on the phone for nearly half-hour after the opening time for my son who has developed a worrying skin condition just to get told there are no appointments and the doctor can't phone me either no advice no nothing this surgery is a disgrace avoid at all costs

title: Below poor.
body: Surgery left a message for my father on 18th May. Ring Surgery, I am his carer he is 84. I have tried three times now and held on 15mins on each occasion. This isn't a one off, it is all the time. Wants a decent manager.

title: Not answering telephone
body: Im so annoyed i was told my call is important to them and to wait in queue then i waited 20 minutes on the phone with a ringing tone waiting for someone to answer my call i ended the call after noone answered my call after 25 minutes disgusting customer service.

title: terrible booking system
body: Trying to book an appointment at this surgery is very frustrating wish there was another lcoal prcatice I could join.  The Doctors are fine but the booking system is terrible

title: Great staff
body: Very quick and well explained, very friendly made to feel at ease from the moment you walk in the door

title: Great service
body: Had longstanding issue which flared up, phoned 9am, on hold 30 mins. I explained situation. Was advised to come and wait as no appointments left. Waited about 95 mins, seen by doctor, issue now diagnosed, given medication.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: incompetant
body:
19/05/2023
1 an on line repeat prescription was made w/c o8/ 05 /2023- today advised not received
2 Two recently issued medications not listed on on-line repeat prescription list
3 w/c 08/05/2023 a telephone call from an undeclared source advised that an eye test could be undertaken in central birmingham" but if this is inconvenient" it could be arranged locally via your gp- an attempt was made to contact gp but had to be abandoned due to lack of response the caller was asked if this was a diabetic eye test the response was it was a /? uv test- upon enquiry the caller did not know what a? uv test was !
4 upon advice from good hope hospital a blood sugar monitor was verbally requested from this practice a rude and brusque refusal was given. good hope hospital have now made a written request -16/05/2023-for this monitor to be provided
RE 2 Udate repeat prescription list
     3 Arrange for the appropriate eye test
     4 Arrange for the monitor to be provided
     5 Employ less rude staff
     And Notify Composers That All Words Cannot Be In 
     Capital Letters At The Start Of The Message Not 
     The End

title: Prescription Issuing Difficulties
body: Not only is it impossible to obtain a doctor’s appointment at the surgery but it seems that delays in obtaining once prescription is now also becoming an issue.  We are only allowed to rebook medication 4 days before the reissue date.  Which is what I adhere too and diarise in order not to run out of repeat medication.  Once recorded it should only take 72 hours to reach the pharmacist.  However I have notice that recently that it takes the prescriptions to be signed a week and then it takes another two days for the pharmacy to make up the prescription which in total means a delay of 7 days to obtain once medication.   When I called the surgery today to enquire why my repeat prescription has not yet been sent to the pharmacy to process I was advised that it usually takes a week.  I disagree, in the past my medication was processed within two days but I noticed over the last year things have gone from bad to worse.  I was advised by the reception staff member that they will mark the prescription as urgent and get it sent to the pharmacy today however that it most probably would only be ready by Monday /Tuesday.  Therefore a delay of 7 days to receive my repeat prescriptions and running out of my medication didn’t seem to be of concern.   To sum up, one can’t get to see a doctor at this practise; one’s medication is delayed so I don’t see the function of this practise anymore.

title: Medium
body:
Phoned at 8.30am, 22 in the queue held on for 1 hour 35 minutes then told there were no appointments. I told the person on the phone I was to have a face to face appointment as instructed by 2 orthopaedic consultants. All she would give me was a telephone appointment for the following day with a Doctor I had never seen before. The consultant is disgusted with this.
I have been with this practice for nearly 60 years & it used to be an excellent practice but is far from it now.
I lost my husband last year who had been with this practice from the day he was born (83 + years) & I am still waiting for them to contact me to see if I am Alright unlike a friend who has been contacted twice by her practice.

title: Total waste of time
body: Appointment did not go head when allocated, second cancelled by their system, third occasion GP said I should have been informed to supply photos before appointment. Photos sent but at following appointment a week later I was informed they had not been attached to my file, so they would have to make enquiries to find out why they had not been added. I was told there would be no point arranging a further appointment until the photos could be seen. So no further forward three weeks later, which will now lead to a delay of at least another week.

title: appauling customer care
body: called for an appointment for my daughter to be seen (not even 2 yet) was told no appointments and if i was that concerned go to A & E. No wonder the NHS is in crisis. Not the first time this has happened, service is a joke

title: Disgusting treatment
body: I saw the gynaecologist and told him openly about my problems and trauma of multiple loses and he brushed me off by telling me what i need is a psychiatrist. As a person who sufferes mental health i felt discriminated and fobbed off and left my appointment sobbing. 0 compasion 0 care just there for a pay cheque and nothing more.

title: Worst Practice
body:
i had a very bad experiences with this practice. my child had few skin issues, we called many times to get the appointment, they just kept rejected. then they asked to send the picture, they dont even care.never gave the appointments till date.
second incident was for myself, i had a very low vit-D and high cholestrol levels. i need to do one blood test to check for my sugar levels and vit-d. but they directly rejected  and said , if u r not well , visit a&e. how can you say , by talking to a person if his cholestrol, vit-d is fine withoutout doing tests. really a terrible practice. i am not sure how nhs allows these gp's to function.

title: Appointment process
body:
Today 19th May i tried to make an appointment for a health check up,it is not an emergency so thought this would be a simple process to be seen some date in future,no this surgery only takes emergency cases but all emergency appointments are booked for w/c 22/5/23,was advised by patient coordinator to call back on 29/5 not before.
Also i had diabetes review booked for 20/4 this was cancelled by surgery rearranged for 2/5 with telephone follow up with diabetes nurse on 19/5,this was subsequently cancelled by surgery,rebooked for 1/6,4 weeks after review and 12 weeks after a text from surgery asking me to make  the original appt which was then cancelled
Thankfully i am not vulnerable,elderly or infirm how do these people handle this sort of situation.
What is going on

title: Worst experience
body: I’m a 39f with no health problems so when I’m December i got sciatica in my left leg I just though it was a trapped nerve and after a week it felt better but was never the same so after Christmas I called the surgery to see a doctor as the pain in my hip wouldn’t go, of course like the rest of the reviews I could not get an appointment and called throughout the month with no success so in February I spoke to receptionist and told them my problem only to be told very rudely with no compassion or empathy well nothing they can do keep trying, told them the pain is not going it’s getting worse the receptionist did not care at all. So I gave up it’s now may the pain is still in my hip and has now gone to my back as well. I been trying since February on and off to get an appointment with no success so called the receptionist today, to see if the receptionist could tell mehow else I can, I was the phone crying telling this receptionist that I’m getting scared now as all I know this could be cancer, I didn’t get a chance to ask the question as the receptionist was very rude, constantly over talking me, snapping at me telling to call at 8 tomorrow. I don’t write reviews but my experience has been awful, no one has the right no matter ur job title is, to treat people so poorly like there less than people

title: Healthcare service
body:
Directions & Name & address were unclear
Without Google app would have got lost
Entrance to Healthcare should be signposted
Name of Healthcare nowhere to be seen
Waiting area claustrophobic
No privacy for unclothing 
Staff professional & friendly

title: Great practice
body:
Was seen today at almost no notice.
The surgery has always been most helpful
I have been a patient for many years

title: Disgraceful Treatment
body: Absolute disgrace of a surgery.. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.. they called me, I missed the call due to being at work.. they left a voicema to say call back urgently.. called back, was on hold for 50 mins, 1st in the queue for 20mins and then 6pm, the call just dropped.. disgusting customer service.. stay as far away as possible from this place.. no heart, no desire in the staff.. treat patients like garbage..

title: Prescription
body: 3 year's an 3 split discs in bottom of back have picked my tablets up every 2 weeks on Friday cause Mrs put prescription in Friday just after dinner week before told to come back Monday im in horrendous pain without them ive tryed cutting down but is horrible pain without surely 10 steps and a signature would of prevented me going through a horrendous weekend ridiculous customer service thank you

title: Repeat prescription
body: I requested a repeat prescription of Utrogestan which hadn't been dispensed by the pharmacy.  I was informed it had not been sent by the surgery.  I attended the surgery and spoke to the receptionist, who was most helpful, I was informed it had been refused by the pharmacist, no documentation stating why.   I was slightly annoyed by this.  I was advised by the receptionist to contact NHS 111 for an emergency prescription, which I did.  I was also given an appointment to speak to the pharmacist.  I attended another pharmacy to collect the prescription.  I was given 9 tablets for the same price as a 3 month prescription of the same medication.  I was contacted by the pharmacist four days later to discuss the matter.I asked why it had been stopped as my HRT medication had changed to patches.  I don't recall being advised to stop Utrogestan.  The pharmacist advised that I would have to contact the practice nurse to clarify why it had been stopped.  I managed to get a cancellation phone appointment for a couple of days later.  I received an evening call and it was clarified why the medication had been refused.  If I had been aware of why, it would have saved time for all concerned and a great deal of anguish for me.  In all, the process took a week, communication between Practitioner and patient wasn't clear, it was an expense that I didn't need.  Maybe when patients medication is on repeat prescription and it is stopped, an email to inform the patient could be helpful?  Emails are sent to patients regarding other services that are available at your surgery.  Just a thought.

title: No time!
body: 3 times I've been told by the same GP she doesn't have time to explain my illnesses to me as she is too busy! Just keep getting prescribed medication, trial and error, but no explanations as there is no time, I understand they are completely overworked, but I need to know what's wrong with me! Another doctor just guessed and prescribed antibiotics for what turned out to be a spot! Everything is always dealt with paracetamol and guess work!
